description.p: New Markdown parser added, with built-in wiki-style inter-note linking.

My little Mac app is now up to version 3.0.0, is up to 10 ratings in the Mac app store, and still has an average rating of 4.9! I've received lots of feedback about the app over the last few months, and the latest release is better than ever!

item.title: Rolling Stone 500 Blog Makes It Thru the First 80 Albums

description.p: Brian, Charlie and I have now published our thoughts on the bottom 80 of Rolling Stone's list of the 500 best albums of all time. Check it out!

item.title: Assessment of Democratic Presidential Candidates - Jan 2020

description.p: This is my assessment of the Democratic candidates for the US presidency, following the debates on the evening of 14 Jan 2020.

item.title: Dethroning the False God of User Experience Design

description.p: As users of computers, do we really want our experiences to be so carefully and intentionally and restrictively designed for us?

item.title: My Prayer for a More Integral New Year

description.p: I want to take a moment to offer up a prayer – not to God, but to all of us – for a more integral sense of who we are in the new year.

item.title: Blogging Further Down the list of the Rolling Stone Top 500 Albums

description.p: Some of the albums in the latest batch flew like eagles, while others sank like stones. Check out our latest multi-generational assessments of the top 500 albums of all time.
Multiple recent releases, a rating of 4.9, users across the globe, and a mention from a Mac blogger. It's been a good couple of months for my Notenik app!
